title: The nobles of Franconia and Saxony elect Henry the Fowler at the Imperial Diet in Fritzlar as king of the East Frankish Kingdom.
text: The nobles of Franconia and Saxony elect Henry the Fowler at the Imperial Diet in Fritzlar as king of the East Frankish Kingdom.

title: The Fifth Crusade leaves Acre for Egypt.
text: The Fifth Crusade leaves Acre for Egypt.

title: Magnus Ladulås is crowned King of Sweden in Uppsala Cathedral.
text: Magnus Ladulås is crowned King of Sweden in Uppsala Cathedral.

title: The ten-year-old Lambert Simnel is crowned in Christ Church Cathedral, Dublin, Ireland, with the name of Edward VI in a bid to threaten King Henry VII's reign.
text: The ten-year-old Lambert Simnel is crowned in Christ Church Cathedral, Dublin, Ireland, with the name of Edward VI in a bid to threaten King Henry VII's reign.

title: Erik XIV of Sweden and his guards murder five incarcerated Swedish nobles.
text: Erik XIV of Sweden and his guards murder five incarcerated Swedish nobles.

title: Nomenclator of Leiden University Library appears, the first printed catalog of an institutional library.
text: Nomenclator of Leiden University Library appears, the first printed catalog of an institutional library.

title: 100 English settlers disembark in Jamestown, the first permanent English colony in America.
text: 100 English settlers disembark in Jamestown, the first permanent English colony in America.

title: The Protestant Union is formally dissolved.
text: The Protestant Union is formally dissolved.

title: Peter Minuit buys Manhattan.
text: Peter Minuit buys Manhattan.

title: The French Royal Army crosses the border into the Spanish Netherlands, starting the War of Devolution opposing France to the Spanish Empire and the Triple Alliance.
text: The French Royal Army crosses the border into the Spanish Netherlands, starting the War of Devolution opposing France to the Spanish Empire and the Triple Alliance.

title: The Ashmolean Museum in Oxford, England, opens as the world's first university museum.
text: The Ashmolean Museum in Oxford, England, opens as the world's first university museum.

title: The English Parliament passes the Act of Toleration protecting dissenting Protestants but excluding Roman Catholics.
text: The English Parliament passes the Act of Toleration protecting dissenting Protestants but excluding Roman Catholics.

title: John Wesley is converted, essentially launching the Methodist movement; the day is celebrated annually by Methodists as Aldersgate Day and a church service is generally held on the preceding Sunday.
text: John Wesley is converted, essentially launching the Methodist movement; the day is celebrated annually by Methodists as Aldersgate Day and a church service is generally held on the preceding Sunday.

title: The Irish Rebellion of 1798 led by the United Irishmen against British rule begins.
text: The Irish Rebellion of 1798 led by the United Irishmen against British rule begins.

title: South American independence leader Simón Bolívar enters Mérida, leading the invasion of Venezuela, and is proclaimed El Libertador ("The Liberator").
text: South American independence leader Simón Bolívar enters Mérida, leading the invasion of Venezuela, and is proclaimed El Libertador ("The Liberator").

title: Battle of Pichincha: Antonio José de Sucre secures the independence of the Presidency of Quito.
text: Battle of Pichincha: Antonio José de Sucre secures the independence of the Presidency of Quito.

title: "Mary Had a Little Lamb" by Sarah Josepha Hale is published.
text: "Mary Had a Little Lamb" by Sarah Josepha Hale is published.

title: The First Kingdom of Greece is declared in the London Conference.
text: The First Kingdom of Greece is declared in the London Conference.

title: Samuel Morse sends the message "What hath God wrought" (a biblical quotation, Numbers 23:23) from a committee room in the United States Capitol to his assistant, Alfred Vail, in Baltimore, Maryland, to inaugurate a commercial telegraph line between Baltimore and Washington D.C.
text: Samuel Morse sends the message "What hath God wrought" (a biblical quotation, Numbers 23:23) from a committee room in the United States Capitol to his assistant, Alfred Vail, in Baltimore, Maryland, to inaugurate a commercial telegraph line between Baltimore and Washington D.C.

title: John Brown and his men kill five slavery supporters at Pottawatomie Creek, Kansas.
text: John Brown and his men kill five slavery supporters at Pottawatomie Creek, Kansas.

title: American Civil War: Union troops occupy Alexandria, Virginia.
text: American Civil War: Union troops occupy Alexandria, Virginia.

title: The Brooklyn Bridge in New York City is opened to traffic after 14 years of construction.
text: The Brooklyn Bridge in New York City is opened to traffic after 14 years of construction.

title: Second Boer War: The United Kingdom annexes the Orange Free State.
text: Second Boer War: The United Kingdom annexes the Orange Free State.

title: World War I: Italy declares war on Austria-Hungary, joining the conflict on the side of the Allies.
text: World War I: Italy declares war on Austria-Hungary, joining the conflict on the side of the Allies.

title: Amy Johnson lands in Darwin, Northern Territory, becoming the first woman to fly solo from England to Australia (she left on May 5 for the 11,000 mile flight).
text: Amy Johnson lands in Darwin, Northern Territory, becoming the first woman to fly solo from England to Australia (she left on May 5 for the 11,000 mile flight).

title: The first night game in Major League Baseball history is played in Cincinnati, Ohio, with the Cincinnati Reds beating the Philadelphia Phillies 2–1 at Crosley Field.
text: The first night game in Major League Baseball history is played in Cincinnati, Ohio, with the Cincinnati Reds beating the Philadelphia Phillies 2–1 at Crosley Field.

title: Igor Sikorsky performs the first successful single-rotor helicopter flight.
text: Igor Sikorsky performs the first successful single-rotor helicopter flight.

title: Acting on the orders of Soviet leader Joseph Stalin, NKVD agent Iosif Grigulevich orchestrates an unsuccessful assassination attempt on exiled Russian revolutionary Leon Trotsky in Coyoacán, Mexico.
text: Acting on the orders of Soviet leader Joseph Stalin, NKVD agent Iosif Grigulevich orchestrates an unsuccessful assassination attempt on exiled Russian revolutionary Leon Trotsky in Coyoacán, Mexico.

title: World War II: In the Battle of the Atlantic, the German Battleship Bismarck sinks then-pride of the Royal Navy, HMS Hood, killing all but three crewmen.
text: World War II: In the Battle of the Atlantic, the German Battleship Bismarck sinks then-pride of the Royal Navy, HMS Hood, killing all but three crewmen.

title: Arab–Israeli War: Egypt captures the Israeli kibbutz of Yad Mordechai, but the five-day effort gives Israeli forces time to prepare enough to stop the Egyptian advance a week later.
text: Arab–Israeli War: Egypt captures the Israeli kibbutz of Yad Mordechai, but the five-day effort gives Israeli forces time to prepare enough to stop the Egyptian advance a week later.

title: The first Eurovision Song Contest is held in Lugano, Switzerland.
text: The first Eurovision Song Contest is held in Lugano, Switzerland.

title: United Press International is formed through a merger of the United Press and the International News Service.
text: United Press International is formed through a merger of the United Press and the International News Service.

title: Following the 1960 Valdivia earthquake, the largest ever recorded earthquake, Cordón Caulle begins to erupt.
text: Following the 1960 Valdivia earthquake, the largest ever recorded earthquake, Cordón Caulle begins to erupt.

title: American civil rights movement: Freedom Riders are arrested in Jackson, Mississippi, for "disturbing the peace" after disembarking from their bus.
text: American civil rights movement: Freedom Riders are arrested in Jackson, Mississippi, for "disturbing the peace" after disembarking from their bus.

title: Project Mercury: American astronaut Scott Carpenter orbits the Earth three times in the Aurora 7 space capsule.
text: Project Mercury: American astronaut Scott Carpenter orbits the Earth three times in the Aurora 7 space capsule.

title: Egypt imposes a blockade and siege of the Red Sea coast of Israel.
text: Egypt imposes a blockade and siege of the Red Sea coast of Israel.

title: The Judgment of Paris takes place in France, launching California as a worldwide force in the production of quality wine.
text: The Judgment of Paris takes place in France, launching California as a worldwide force in the production of quality wine.

title: Ecuadorian president Jaime Roldós Aguilera, his wife, and his presidential committee die in an aircraft accident while travelling from Quito to Zapotillo minutes after the president gave a famous speech regarding the 24 de mayo anniversary of the Battle of Pichincha.
text: Ecuadorian president Jaime Roldós Aguilera, his wife, and his presidential committee die in an aircraft accident while travelling from Quito to Zapotillo minutes after the president gave a famous speech regarding the 24 de mayo anniversary of the Battle of Pichincha.

title: Liberation of Khorramshahr: Iranians recapture of the port city of Khorramshahr from the Iraqis during the Iran–Iraq War.
text: Liberation of Khorramshahr: Iranians recapture of the port city of Khorramshahr from the Iraqis during the Iran–Iraq War.

title: Section 28 of the United Kingdom's Local Government Act 1988, a controversial amendment stating that a local authority cannot intentionally promote homosexuality, is enacted.
text: Section 28 of the United Kingdom's Local Government Act 1988, a controversial amendment stating that a local authority cannot intentionally promote homosexuality, is enacted.

title: Israel conducts Operation Solomon, evacuating Ethiopian Jews to Israel.
text: Israel conducts Operation Solomon, evacuating Ethiopian Jews to Israel.

title: The last Thai dictator, General Suchinda Kraprayoon, resigns following pro-democracy protests.
text: The last Thai dictator, General Suchinda Kraprayoon, resigns following pro-democracy protests.

title: The ethnic cleansing in Kozarac, Bosnia and Herzegovina begins when Serbian militia and police forces enter the town.
text: The ethnic cleansing in Kozarac, Bosnia and Herzegovina begins when Serbian militia and police forces enter the town.

title: Eritrea gains its independence from Ethiopia.
text: Eritrea gains its independence from Ethiopia.

title: Four men convicted of bombing the World Trade Center in New York in 1993 are each sentenced to 240 years in prison.
text: Four men convicted of bombing the World Trade Center in New York in 1993 are each sentenced to 240 years in prison.

title: The International Criminal Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia in The Hague, Netherlands indicts Slobodan Milošević and four others for war crimes and crimes against humanity committed in Kosovo.
text: The International Criminal Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia in The Hague, Netherlands indicts Slobodan Milošević and four others for war crimes and crimes against humanity committed in Kosovo.

title: Israeli troops withdraw from southern Lebanon after 22 years of occupation.
text: Israeli troops withdraw from southern Lebanon after 22 years of occupation.

title: Russia and the United States sign the Moscow Treaty.
text: Russia and the United States sign the Moscow Treaty.

title: A 6.4 magnitude earthquake occurs in the Aegean Sea between Greece and Turkey, injuring 324 people.
text: A 6.4 magnitude earthquake occurs in the Aegean Sea between Greece and Turkey, injuring 324 people.

title: At least three people are killed in a shooting at Brussels' Jewish Museum of Belgium.
